name: A Walk To The Bus
description:
This game was designed in 3D and can be played on any desktop computer. This game was developed for the ILRN Game Jam 2021.

Overview of the Game/Player Instructions:

You have been living in the city of Burnsville. It is disgusting and the environment is just ‘Gross!’ Because of these conditions, you're on your way to the bus stop to leave the city to never return. Along the way, your friend, Ray, is worried about you and is asking to take time to talk with them before you leave. Ray is begging you stay and that it is not as bad as you think. You get on the bus to leave but wait...you wake back up again in your apartment from earlier in the morning? But How? 

In this game, we wanted to show that climate actions do not have to be big in order to show changes in your environment while encompassing UN Goal 13 for climate action. This game is aimed at showing that simple tasks that can be performed on your way to your end goal can affect the environment around you. As you play this game, you will notice the subtle changes that are taking place around you. Climate action does not have to be big, it's the little tasks that help inspire the others to take action on the climate as well! 

To move about the world:

Pane Camera: Move your mouse around

Move: WASD key

Interact with UI: Left Mouse Button
